A|EV-DO Rev. A]] 800 and 1,900 MHz;

{{convert|64.2|mm|in|abbr=on}} W
{{convert|9.9|â|14|mm|in|abbr=on}} D. | weight = {{convert|118|â|155|g|oz|abbr=on}}. | type = [[Touchscreen mobile device|Touchscreen]] [[smartphone]] [[Android (operating system)|Android]] | form = [[Mobile phone form factors#Slate|Slate]] (most versions)
[[Mobile phone form factors#Slider|Slider]] (Sprint version) | music = | series = Samsung Galaxy S | predecessor = [[Samsung i7500|Samsung Galaxy i-7500]] | successor = [[Samsung Galaxy S II]] | related = [[Samsung Galaxy Player]], [[Galaxy Nexus]] | other = TV out, integrated messaging ''Social Hub'', Android Market, Samsung Apps, [[A-GPS]], augmented reality with Layar Reality Browser, video messaging. Exchange ActiveSync, offline, and no SIM Mode, voice command, RSS reader, widgets, smart security{{cite news | title=Samsung Unpacked | newsweb=[[Samsung Electronics]] | date= 2010-04-18 | url=http://www.samsungunpacked.com/ | accessdate=18 April 2010}} }} The '''Samsung Galaxy S''' is an [[Android (operating system)|Android]] [[smartphone]] that was announced by Samsung in March 2010. It features a 1 GHz [[ARM architecture|ARM]] "[[Samsung Hummingbird|Hummingbird]]" processor, 8–16 GB internal Flash memory, a 4-inch 480Ã800 pixel [[Super AMOLED]] capacitive touchscreen display, [[Wi-Fi]] connectivity, a 5-[[Pixel#Megapixel|megapixel]] camera with a maximum resolution of 2560x1920 and, on select models, a front-facing 0.3 MP [[Video Graphics Array|VGA]] camera (640x480).{{citation|url=http://www.geeky-gadgets.com/samsung-i9000-galaxy-s-android-smartphone-in-action-video-24-03-2010/|title=Samsung i9000 Galaxy S Android Smartphone In Action â Video|author=|date=24 March 2010|work=Geeky Gadgets}}{{citation|url=http://www.slashgear.com/samsung-galaxy-s-gt-i9000-android-2-1-smartphone-announced-2378775/|title=Samsung Galaxy S GT-I9000 Android 2.1 smartphone announced|author=|date=23 March 2010|work=SlashGear}} The base version of the phone, the GT-I9000, was quickly followed by variant models for the US carriers such as the Epic 4G, Vibrant, Captivate, Fascinate, and Mesmerize. The Samsung Galaxy S features a [[PowerVR]] graphics processor, yielding 20 million triangles per second, {{Cite web |url=http://www.samsung.com/global/business/semiconductor/productInfo.do?fmly_id=834&partnum=S5PC110&xFmly_id=229 |archiveurl=http://web.archive.org/web/20110716002952/http://www.samsung.com/global/business/semiconductor/productInfo.do?fmly_id=834&partnum=S5PC110&xFmly_id=229 |archivedate=16 July 2011 |title=SAMSUNG S5PC110 - ARM Cortex A8 based Mobile Application Processor |work=Samsung |accessdate=27 October 2011 }} making it the fastest graphics processing unit in any smartphone at the time of release. {{Cite web |url=http://androidandme.com/2010/03/news/samsung-galaxy-s-hummingbird-chip-to-have-3x-gpu-power-of-snapdragon/ |title=Samsung Galaxy S "Hummingbird" chip to have 3x GPU power of Snapdragon |date=26 March 2010 |work=Android and Me }} Also, upon release, the Galaxy S was both the first Android phone to be certified for [[DivX]] HD, {{Cite web |url= http://finance.yahoo.com/news/Samsung-Galaxy-S-is-Worlds-prnews-2268372508.html |title=Samsung Galaxy S is World's First DivX HD Certified Android Mobile Phone - Yahoo! Finance |work=Yahoo Finance |date=24 August 2010 |accessdate=16 November 2010 }} and at 9.9 mm was the thinnest smartphone available. {{Cite |url=http://androidandme.com/2010/03/news/5-reasons-to-wait-for-the-samsung-galaxy-s/ |title=5 reasons to wait for the Samsung Galaxy S |date=30 March 2010 |work=Android and Me }} As of January 2011, Samsung had sold 10 million Galaxy S phones globally. {{Cite web |url= http://www.bloomberg.com/news/2011-01-03/samsung-says-it-sold-10-million-galaxy-s-smartphones-since-debut-in-june.html |title=Samsung Electronics Says It Sold 10 Million Galaxy S Smartphones |work=Bloomberg |date=3 January 2011 |accessdate=3 January 2011 }} The Galaxy S was named the European Smartphone of the Year at the [[European Imaging and Sound Association]] (EISA) Awards 2010â2011. {{Cite web |url= http://www.eisa.eu/award/53/european-smartphone-2010-2011.html |title=European Smartphone 2010â2011 - Samsung Galaxy S GT-I9000 |work=EISA - European Imaging and Sound Association |accessdate=16 November 2010 }} Samsung Galaxy S was succeeded by [[Samsung Galaxy S II]]. In October 2011, Samsung announced that it had sold 30 Million Galaxy S and Galaxy S II phones globally.{{cite web|url=http://www.pcmag.com/article2/0,2817,2394782,00.asp#fbid=yJL_Tc-aX7ll |title=Samsung Galaxy S Sales Hit 30 Million|publisher = [[PC Magazine]]|accessdate = 18 October 2011}} ==Launch== The phone was initially launched in Singapore on June 4, 2010. {{Cite web |url= http://www.techknots.com/mobiles/samsung-galaxy-s-to-arrive-in-singapore-first/ |author=Vikas SN |title=Samsung Galaxy S to arrive in Singapore first |work=MobileKnots |date=28 May 2010 |accessdate=28 November 2010 }} Before the end of its first weekend on sale in Singapore, Samsung [[Twitter|tweeted]] that Singtel, the exclusive carrier to sell the device in Singapore, were sold out of devices. {{Cite web |url= http://www.eurodroid.com/2010/06/samsung-galaxy-s-launched-in-singapore-already-sold-out/ |title=Samsung Galaxy S launched in Singapore â already sold out |work=Eurodroid |date=6 June 2010 |accessdate=28 November 2010 }} On Friday June 25, 2010, the phone was launched in Malaysia and South Korea. {{Cite web |url= http://www.soyacincau.com/2010/06/28/first-impressions-samsung-galaxy-s/ |title=First impressions: Samsung Galaxy S |work=Soyacincau |date=28 June 2010 |accessdate=28 November 2010 }} {{Cite web |url= http://www.bizplace.co.kr/biz_html/content/naver_content_view.php?seq_no=32653&page=1&b_code=%20(Korean) |title=ìí¼ ì¤ë§í¸í° 'ê°¤ë­ìS' ì êµ­ íë§¤ ëì |work=BIZPlace |date=24 June 2010 |accessdate=28 November 2010 }} Overall the launch schedule comprised launches on 110 carriers in 100 countries at the same time. {{Cite web |url= http://english.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2010/06/03/2010060301729.html |title=Samsung's Galaxy S Smartphone to Debut in 100 Countries Worldwide |work=The Chosunilbo |accessdate=28 November 2010 }} U.S. Variants named as Epic, Vibrant, Fascinate, Captivate, and Mesmerize were released from June through September 2010. ==Reception== [[CNET|CNET Asia]] gave the Galaxy S a favorable review with a score of 8.4/10. The Galaxy S was compared to current high-end Android-based phones such as the [[HTC Desire]], [[Sony Ericsson Xperia X10|Xperia X10]], [[Nexus S]], and smartphones using different operating systems like the [[iPhone 4]], which runs [[iOS (Apple)|iOS]], and [[HTC HD2]], which runs [[Windows Mobile]] in [[CNET|CNET Asia]]. {{Cite web |url= http://asia.cnet.com/reviews/mobilephones/0,39051199,45229322p,00.htm |title=Samsung Galaxy S (I9000) Product Review |author=John Chan |work=CNET Asia |date=4 June 2010 |accessdate=28 November 2010 }} GSMArena.com described the Galaxy S as having "perfect audio quality," claiming the phone's superior all-round performance made it a "new leader of the Android pack." {{Cite web |url= http://www.gsmarena.com/samsung_i9000_galaxy_s-review-478.php |title=Samsung I9000 Galaxy S review: From outer space |author=GSMArena team |work=GSM Arena |date=22 May 2010 |accessdate=28 November 2010 }} TIME listed the Galaxy S as #2 device in "Top 10 Gadgets" of 2010, praising its Super AMOLED display. {{Cite web |url= http://www.time.com/time/specials/packages/article/0,28804,2035319_2033840_2033837,00.html |title=Top 10 Gadgets. 2. Samsung Galaxy S |author=Doug Aamoth |work=TIME |date=9 December 2010 |accessdate=10 December 2010 }} The phone was criticized by some reviewers for sub-par GPS performance. Anandtech, reviewing the Epic 4G variant, said "the phone will take an inordinate amount of time to determine your actual location, and/or it wonât pinpoint your location very accurately." {{Cite web |url= http://www.anandtech.com/show/3891/samsung-epic-4g-review-the-fastest-android-phone/10 |title=Samsung Epic 4G Review: The Fastest Android Phone |author=Anand Lal Shimpi |date=6 September 2010 |work=anandtech.com |accessdate=28 November 2010 }} Engadget described the GPS in the Vibrant and Captivate variants as "utterly broken and non-functional... this is a problem for which there's no reasonable explanation why it made it all the way to retail devices." {{Cite web |url= http://mobile.engadget.com/2010/08/02/wheres-the-gps-fix-for-the-samsung-vibrant-and-captivate/ |title=Where's the GPS fix for the Samsung Vibrant and Captivate? |work=Engadget |author=Chris Ziegler |date=2 August 2010 |accessdate=28 November 2010 }} Samsung released an application for the Captivate and Vibrant variants only that resets the phone's GPS settings to factory defaults. {{Cite web |url= http://ars.samsung.com/customer/usa/jsp/faqs/faqs_view_us.jsp?SITE_ID=22&PG_ID=2&PROD_SUB_ID=557&PROD_ID=560&AT_ID=310254 |title=I Am Having Difficulties Obtaining An Accurate Location Fix. How Can I Increase The Accuracy On My SGH-t959 (Vibrant) Phone? |work=Samsung.com |accessdate=12 December 2010 }} [[TechRadar]] acknowledged GPS faults in the Galaxy S, and stated that these have been fixed in the Google [[Nexus S]]. {{cite web |url=http://www.techradar.com/reviews/phones/mobile-phones/google-nexus-s-913562/review?artc_pg=8" |title=Google Nexus S review |publisher=[[TechRadar]] |date=2010-12-16 }} ==Hardware== === Processor === The Samsung Galaxy S used the Samsung S5PC110 processor. This processor combined a 45 nm 1 GHz [[ARM Cortex-A8]] based [[CPU]] core with a [[PowerVR]] SGX 540 [[GPU]] made by [[Imagination Technologies]] which supported [[OpenGL ES]] 1.1/2.0{{Cite web|url=http://www.imgtec.com/powervr/powervr-graphics.asp|title=POWERVR Graphics|author=Imagination Technologies Ltd.|accessdate=2010-09-01}} and was capable of up to 20 million triangles per second. The CPU core, code-named "Hummingbird," was co-developed by [[Samsung]] and [[Intrinsity]].{{Cite web|url=http://www.samsung.com/global/business/semiconductor/newsView.do?news_id=1030|title=SAMSUNG and Intrinsity Jointly Develop the World's Fastest ARM Cortex-A8 Processor Based Mobile Core in 45 Nanometer Low Power Process|author=Samsung|date=27 July 2009|accessdate=2010-09-01}} This processor was subsequently renamed to the [[Samsung Exynos#Exynos 3110| Samsung Exynos 3110]] in October 2011.{{fact|date=November 2011}} === Memory === The Samsung Galaxy S has 512 MB of LPDDR2 RAM ([[Mobile DDR]]). Some variants also come with either 8 GB or 16 GB of OneNAND memory combined in a [[Package on package|package-on-package]] stack with the processor. An external [[microSD]] card slot supports up to 32 GB of additional storage memory. {{Cite web |url= http://www.eetimes.com/electronics-news/4206197/Samsung-s-Galaxy-S-smartphone--What-s-under-the-AMOLED-semiconductor?pageNumber=1 |title=Samsung's Galaxy S smartphone: What's under the AMOLED? |work=EE Times |author=Allan Yogasingam |date=14 August 2010 |accessdate=7 December 2010 }} === Screen === The Samsung Galaxy S uses a {{convert|101.6|mm|in|adj=on}} [[Super AMOLED]] touch screen covered by [[Gorilla Glass]], a special crack and scratch resistant material. {{Cite web |url= http://www.engadget.com/2010/08/24/samsung-galaxy-s-sporting-gorilla-glass-to-protect-that-precious/ |title=Samsung Galaxy S sporting Gorilla Glass to protect that precious AMOLED |author=Paul Miller |work=Engadget |date=24 August 2010 |accessdate=28 November 2010 }} The screen is a [[Wide VGA|WVGA]] [[PenTile matrix family|PenTile]] display manufactured by Samsung. The Galaxy S LCD (GT-I9003) has a {{convert|101.6|mm|in|adj=on}} SC-LCD (Super Clear LCD) screen. {{Cite web |url= http://www.techtree.com/India/Reviews/Samsung_Galaxy_S_LCD_GT-I9003_Review/551-114781-614.html |title=Samsung Galaxy S LCD GT-I9003 Review |author=Samir Makwana |work=Techtree.com |date=14 March 2011 |accessdate=04 September 2011 }} === Audio === The phone uses [[Wolfson Microelectronics|Wolfson's]] WM8994 DAC as its audio hub. {{Cite web |url= http://www.phonewreck.com/2010/08/19/samsung-galaxy-s-teardown/ |title=Samsung Galaxy S (i9000) Teardown + Analysis! |work=phoneWreck |date=19 August 2010 |accessdate=15 December 2010 }} ==Software== ===User interface=== The phone employs the latest proprietary Samsung TouchWiz 3.0 user interface. Unlike TouchWiz 3.0 on the Samsung Wave, it allows up to seven homescreens. However, different from other Android user interfaces, TouchWiz 3.0 allows users to add, delete and rearrange homescreens. The program launcher is also different from other Android user interfaces in that it has an [[iOS (Apple)|iOS]]-like program menu which allows customization of shortcuts. In addition, three of the four shortcuts at the bottom of the screen can also be customized. The Epic 4G features a specialized version of TouchWiz based on TouchWiz 2.5. Because of the Epic 4G's QWERTY slide-out keyboard, the homescreen needed to be able to rotate into landscape mode, and accordingly several key features and applications are absent on the Epic. TouchWiz 3.0 devices do not support this feature, and because of that difference, the Epic 4G ships with a heavily modified TouchWiz 2.5 interface. The customization of homescreens, as well as several other features found on TouchWiz 3.0 devices like the Vibrant, Captivate, and Fascinate, is not supported in the version of TouchWiz that ships on the Epic 4G. The most important aspect of all three generations of TouchWiz is the widget interface. The most prominent widgets that come with the Galaxy S are the Daily Briefing, weather clock and the Buddies Now widget. In addition to Samsung widgets, standard Android widgets can be added and removed from the homescreens. ===Bundled applications=== Other provided software includes the [[Layar]] Reality Browser, a program that visualizes GPS direction, and Aldiko, an ebook reader. The phone also comes with various upgraded versions of software that came with Samsung's previous generation of smartphones (such as i8910HD and i8000 Omnia II). ===Media support=== The Galaxy S comes with support for many multimedia file formats, including audio codecs ([[FLAC]], [[WAV]], [[Vorbis]], [[MP3]], [[Advanced Audio Coding|AAC]], [[AAC+]], [[eAAC+]], [[WMA]], [[AMR-NB]], [[AMR-WB]], [[MID]], [[AC3]], [[XMF]]), video codecs ([[mpeg4]], [[H.264]], [[H.263]], [[Sorenson codec]], [[DivX HD]]/ [[XviD]], [[VC-1]]) and video formats ([[3GP]] ([[MPEG-4]]), [[WMV]] ([[Advanced Systems Format]]), [[Audio Video Interleave|AVI]] ([[divx]]), [[Matroska|MKV]], [[FLV]]). ===Updates=== The [[Android (operating system) | Android ]] version is [[mobile network operator | network operator]] dependent and will normally be upgraded over the air, but this will not occur when a handset is configured for one [[mobile network operator | network operator]] but operated on another network.{{fact|date=July 2011}} The latest official [[Android (operating system) | Android ]] version for a handset configured for any carrier is available using the [[Samsung Kies]] application.{{fact|date=July 2011}} There are also third party versions of Android available for the Galaxy S, for example [http://www.darkyrom.com/ Darky's Rom], but installing them may void the owner's warranty.{{fact|date=July 2011}}. Samsung is willing to freely upgrade those early devices which do not update via Kies. In the UK at least any Galaxy S should be upgradable to Android 2.3.3. ====Android 2.2 upgrade==== [[File:Android Market.jpg|thumb|Android Market on Samsung Galaxy S.]] When launched, the Galaxy S had Android 2.1 ("[[Android_(operating_system)#Version_history|Eclair]]") installed. An official upgrade to Android 2.2 ("[[Android_(operating_system)#Version_history|Froyo]]") began rolling out worldwide in November 2010. {{Cite web |url= http://www.engadget.com/2010/10/21/samsung-comes-clean-with-galaxy-s-froyo-upgrade-dates-all-carri/ |title=Samsung comes clean with Galaxy S Froyo upgrade dates: all carriers in November |author=Chris Ziegler |work=Engdaget |accessdate=28 November 2010 }} Canada received the 2.2 upgrade for select carriers on December 10, 2010. {{Cite web |url= http://www.androidincanada.ca/news/bell-galaxy-s-vibrant-android-2-2-upgrade-now-available/ |title=Bell Galaxy S Vibrant Android 2.2 Upgrade Now Available |author=Pedram |work=android in Canada |accessdate=16 December 2010 }} According to Samsung the 2.2 upgrade has come to the USA in 2011 for most versions of the handset (AT&T captivate, Verizon Fascinate, T-mobile Vibrant, Sprint Epic). {{Cite web |url= http://www.gforgames.com/gadgets/news-gadgets/samsung-captivate-fascinate-vibrant-epic-4g-android-22-os-testing-phase-2795/ |title=Samsung Galaxy S Android 2.2 Upgrade In Testing |author=Gforgames |work=android in USA |accessdate=08 January 2011 }} The 2.2 upgrade was released for T-Mobile on January 20, 2011. {{Cite web |url= http://forums.t-mobile.com/t5/Samsung-Vibrant/Samsung-Vibrant-software-upgrade-to-Android-2-2-Froyo-now/td-p/678871 |title= Samsung Vibrant software upgrade to Android 2.2 (Froyo) now available! |author=T-Mobile |work=T-Mobile Community |accessdate = 28 February 2011 }} It enabled stock Android features that had previously been disabled such as Wi-Fi Calling and Mobile AP. Verizon's Fascinate was upgraded to Android 2.2 in April 2011. Verizon's Continuum variant, however, remains on Android 2.1. ====Android 2.3 upgrade==== An Android 2.3 ("[[Android_(operating_system)#Version_history|Gingerbread]]") update became available for Nordic countries, The Netherlands and Germany on April 16, 2011. The update reached UK, Pakistan, India and HongKong by the end of May, 2011. Singapore received the update in June. Australia received the update in August. For other countries it is expected to be available later. The Samsung Epic for Sprint started receiving the Gingerbread update on November 9, 2011 and the update was released for the Samsung Galaxy S 4G on November 15. Currently, the Verizon network is field-testing its gingerbread update for the Samsung Fascinate. As of December 1, 2011, the Samsung Fascinate has been updated to Gingerbread 2.3 ([http://www.droid-life.com/2011/12/01/samsung-fascinate-gingerbread-update-eh03-ready-possibly-rolling-out-now/ Droid-Life]). T-Mobile in the USA made the 2.3 upgrade available on November 15, 2011. Download it at: http://support.t-mobile.com/docs/DOC-1810 . {{Cite web |url= http://www.engadget.com/2011/04/16/galaxy-s-gingerbread-update-now-rolling-out-across-europe/ |title=Android 2.3 for Galaxy S confirmed for March? |author=Vlad Savov |work=engadget |date=16 April 2011 |accessdate=16 April 2011 }} ==Variants== ===In the United States=== The T-Mobile Vibrant, AT&T Captivate, Sprint Epic, and Verizon Fascinate were officially announced at a [[New York City]] launch event on 30 June 2010. {{Cite web |url=http://www.phonearena.com/news/Samsung-Galaxy-S-line-launch-event-in-New-York-City_id12190 |title=Samsung Galaxy S line launch event in New York City |work=USLaunch |accessdate=5 May 2010 }} *[[T-Mobile USA|T-Mobile]] released a version of the phone called the '''Samsung Vibrant''' ''(SGH-T959)'' on July 15, 2010, {{Cite web |url=http://galaxy-s.t-mobile.com/ |title=The New Samsung Vibrant Galaxy S Series Android Smartphone |work=TMobile |accessdate=28 November 2010 }} making it the third Android 2.x phone officially supported on the T-Mobile network (after the Nexus One and MyTouch 3G Slide). The Vibrant supports Quad-band GSM operations as well as the T-Mobile 3G network in the UMTS Band IV ([[Advanced Wireless Services|AWS]], 1700/2100) and also in the UMTS Band I (2100) / II (1900) where coverage and service is available (for example, the Vibrant will work with AT&T 3G where that carrier operates services on the 1,900 MHz band). This variant, however, does not operate in 3G in the UMTS Band V (850) because its hardware is not configured for that frequency. It includes 16 GB of internal flash memory, it lacks a front-facing camera and LED flash. The price was $199 with a new, two-year contract, or less through some distributors. T-Mobile also bundled the film ''[[Avatar (2009 film)|Avatar]]'', preloaded onto a microSD card, with the phone. {{Cite web |url= http://www.engadget.com/2010/08/18/t-mobile-offering-vibrant-for-99-if-youre-quick-about-it/ |title=T-Mobile offering Vibrant for $99, if you're quick about it (update: one cent at Amazon) |work=Engadget |date=18 August 2010 |accessdate=28 November 2010 }} T-Mobile also released the '''Samsung Galaxy S 4G''' ''(SGH-T959V)'' for their [[4G]] (HSPA+) network on 23 February 2011. {{Cite web |url=http://www.engadget.com/2011/02/23/samsung-galaxy-s-4g-now-available-from-t-mobile/ |title=Samsung Galaxy S 4G now available from T-Mobile |work=Engadget |date=23 February 2011 |accessdate=26 March 2011 }} T-Mobile bundled the film ''[[Inception]]'', preloaded onto a microSD card, with this version of the phone. {{Cite web |url=http://www.t-mobile.com/shop/phones/Cell-Phone-Detail.aspx?cell-phone=Samsung-Galaxy-S-4G |title=Samsung Galaxy S 4G phone details from T-Mobile |work=T-Mobile |accessdate=21 April 2011 }} *[[AT&T Mobility|AT&T]] released a variant of this phone for the [[United States]] on July 18, 2010 under the name '''Samsung Captivate''' ''(SGH-I897)''. {{Cite web |url=http://www.engadget.com/2010/07/08/samsung-captivate-coming-to-atandt-on-july-18-for-200/ |title=Samsung Captivate coming to AT&T on July 18 for $200 |work=ATT |accessdate=5 May 2011 }} It includes 16 GB of internal flash memory, but does not have a front camera, FM radio or LED camera flash. [[File:Samsung Galaxy S Sprint jeh.jpg|thumb|Sprint version]] *[[Sprint Nextel|Sprint]] announced the release of '''Samsung Epic 4G''' ''(SPH-D700)'' for August 31, 2010. {{Cite web |url=http://www.androidcentral.com/sprint-stores-open-8-am-tuesday-epic-4g-launch |title=Sprint stores open at 8 a.m. Tuesday for the Epic 4G launch |work=Sprint |accessdate=5 May 2011 }} It features a [[4G]] radio, a full QWERTY keyboard and reworked version of [[Android (operating system)|Android]] 2.1, as well as some downgrades from other Galaxy models, such as a reduced functionality version of TouchWiz, and a number of applications removed. This version is 14.2 mm thick. This includes the front camera of the international version and also adds a camera flash and comes bundled with a 16 GB micro SD memory card. It is also the only Galaxy S variant with a hardware notification LED. {{Cite web |url=http://www.androidcentral.com/sprint-epic-4g-specs |title=Sprint Epic 4G specs |work=Epic |accessdate=5 May 2011 }} The Android 2.2.1 update brings the same [[TouchWiz]] featured on all Galaxy S devices. *[[Verizon Wireless|Verizon]] released the '''Samsung Fascinate''' ''(SCH-I500)'', which removes the front camera found in the international version, and adds a camera flash. {{Cite web |url= http://www.samsung.com/us/mobile/cell-phones/SCH-I500RKAVZW-features |title=Samsung Fascinate Android Smartphone |work=Samsung US |accessdate=28 November 2010 }} The Fascinate was made available on September 9, 2010. {{Cite web |url=http://www.engadget.com/2010/09/07/official-samsung-fascinate-launching-september-9/ |title=Official: Samsung Fascinate launching September 9 for $199 (update: September 8 online) |work=Fascinate |accessdate=5 May 2011 }} Its arrival was heralded by some controversy over Verizon's decision to replace the standard Google Search with Microsoft's Bing Search. Verizon later released the '''Samsung Continuum''' ''(SCH-I400)'' variant which has a smaller 3.4 inch display but adds a small 480Ã96 "ticker" screen underneath the main screen for showing alerts and messages, activated by a grip sensor. {{Cite web |url= http://www.engadget.com/2010/11/08/samsung-continuum-first-hands-on/ |title=Samsung Continuum first hands-on (update: video!) |work=Engadget |author=Ross Miller |date=8 November 2010 |accessdate=28 November 2010 }} The Continuum was made available November 18, 2010. The Fascinate received the Android 2.2 update on April 21, 2011. On October 13, 2011, Verizon released the Samsung Stratosphere, a Galaxy S phone similar to that of the Epic 4G, and features a 5-row QWERTY keyboard and the Android 2.3 "gingerbread" software. As of December 1, 2011, the Fascinate has been updated to Gingerbread 2.3 ([http://www.droid-life.com/2011/12/01/samsung-fascinate-gingerbread-update-eh03-ready-possibly-rolling-out-now/ Droid-Life]). *[[US Cellular]] launched the '''Samsung Mesmerize''' on 27 October 2010. {{Cite web |url=http://www.androidguys.com/2010/10/27/samsung-mesmerize-launches-cellular/ |title=Samsung Mesmerize Launches on U.S. Cellular |work=Mesmerize |accessdate=5 May 2011 }} [[C Spire Wireless]] (formerly Cellular South), also in the US, currently offers a Galaxy S models named '''Samsung Showcase'''. They are very similar, if not identical, to the hardware of Verizon's Samsung Fascinate ''(SCH-I500)''. {{Cite web |url= http://www.samsung.com/us/mobile/cell-phones/SCH-I500RKAUSC |title=Samsung Mesmerize i500 Touch Screen Cell Phone |work=Samsung US |accessdate=28 November 2010 }} {{Cite web |url= http://www.samsung.com/us/mobile/cell-phones/SCH-I500RKAXAR |title=Samsung Showcase i500 Android Smartphone |work=Samsung US |accessdate=28 November 2010 }} *[[MetroPCS]] began to offer the '''Samsung Galaxy Indulge''', which is the first 4G LTE Android smartphone in the U.S., on February 21, 2011. The Indulge shrinks the screen size from 4 inches to 3.5 inches, removes the front facing camera, reduces the camera to 3.2 megapixels, removes the flash,lowers the screen resolution from 800x400 pixels to HVGA 480 x 320 pixels, and adds a keyboard. MetroPCS also bundled the film [[Iron Man 2]] preloaded onto a 4 GB micro sd card with the phone. ===In Canada=== All of Canada Galaxy S phone support Six-axis sensor : Combining the accelerometer and gyroscope. *[[Rogers Wireless|Rogers]] released their Galaxy S phone under the '''Samsung Galaxy S Captivate''' (''SGH-I896'') name. It is identical to the Samsung Captivate on [[AT&T Mobility]] with minor changes to things like GPS functionality, and it ships with Rogers branding. {{Cite web |url= http://www.rogers.com/web/link/wirelessBuyFlow?forwardTo=PhoneThenPlan&productType=normal&productId_Detailed=I896BLKR&cm_mmc=Redirects-_-Consumer_Wireless_Eng-_-SamsungGalaxyS_0908-_-captivate |title=Samsung Galaxy S Captivate |work=Rogers |accessdate=28 November 2010 }} *[[Bell Mobility|Bell]], [[Virgin Mobile Canada|Virgin Mobile]] and [[SaskTel]] released their Galaxy S phone under the '''Samsung Galaxy S Vibrant''' (''GT-I9000M'') name. {{Cite web |url= http://galaxys.bell.ca/index.html |title=The Samsung Galaxy S(TM) Vibrant(TM) is available now, only from Bell. Find it online and in stores. |work=galaxys.bell.ca |accessdate=28 November 2010 }} This Galaxy S phone is very similar to the international GT-I9000 with 16 GB of flash memory, tri-band HSPA+ @ 21 Mbit/s support, a front facing camera and six-axis sensor combines the accelerometer and gyroscope. * note international GT-I9000 does not support six-axis sensor but Samsung Galaxy S(TM) Vibrant(TM) does support. *[[Telus Mobility|Telus]] released their Galaxy S phone in May 2011 under the '''Samsung Galaxy S Fascinate 4G''' (''SGH-T959P'') name. The Telus Galaxy S Fascinate 4G This is an upgraded version of the Samsung Galaxy S Fascinate 3G+. It supports 4G HSPA+ Networks and adds a front facing camera. *[[Telus Mobility|Telus]] released their Galaxy S phone under the '''Samsung Galaxy S Fascinate 3G+''' (''SGH-T959D'') name. The Telus Galaxy S Fascinate {{Cite web |url=http://www.samsung.com/ca/consumer/mobile/mobile-phones/all-phones/SGH-T959HKATLS/index.idx?pagetype=prd_detail&tab=specification |title=The Samsung Galaxy S Fascinate(TM) 3G+ |work=Samsung |accessdate=18 January 2011 }} is the very similar to the [[T-Mobile USA]] Galaxy S Vibrant (''SGH-T959''), however it only supports 850/1900/2100 MHz 3G networks and has minor software differences. It shares no direct relation to the [[Verizon Wireless]] Galaxy S Fascinate as there are major hardware differences. ===In India=== Samsung released the Galaxy S I9000 in June 2010 in India and became the highest selling smartphone in the Indian market in the year 2010. ===In Mexico=== *[[Telcel]] released the Samsung Galaxy S '''GT I9000T''' model on October 2010, available exclusively to its customers. ===In Australia=== *[[Telstra]] released the Samsung Galaxy S '''GT-I9000T''' model, available exclusively to its customers in the local market. Its form factor is identical to the '''GT-I9000''' (As used by all other Australian carriers and retailers) but with support for 850 MHz 3G instead of 900 MHz 3G. The '''GT-I9000T''' supports 850/1900/2100 MHz 3G. ===In Brazil=== *In Brazil there is only one model of the Galaxy S, known as '''GT-I9000B''', based on the '''GT-I9000''' base model, but with the addition of an [[ISDB-T]] [[1seg]] tuner for [[digital television]]. They are manufactured locally by Samsung, to take advantage of tax cuts associated with the local production. It is possible to record ISDB-T 1seg broadcasts to a memory card for playback later, and take screenshots of the programs. The tuner also supports features like a programming guide and Closed Caption. This model is also available in the rest of Latin American countries. ===In South Korea=== *There are two variants of the Galaxy S in South Korea. As well as '''Galaxy S (SHW-M110S)''' exclusively for [[SK Telecom]] subscribers, "'''Galaxy U (SHW-M130L)'''" (which is slightly smaller and has [[AMOLED Plus]] instead of [[Super AMOLED]]) for [[LG U+]] and "'''Galaxy K (SHW-M130K)'''" for [[KT]] are also available. All the South Korean variants have [[T-DMB]] tuner, and are sold under "[[Anycall]]" branding. ===In China=== There are three Galaxy S variants available in China: {{Cite web |url= http://www.samsung.com/us/aboutsamsung/news/newsIrRead.do?news_seq=19608&news_ctgry=irnewsrelease&page=6&rdoPeriod=ALL&from_dt=&to_dt=&search_keyword= |title=Samsung Launches the Galaxy S in China Together with Three Major Mobile Operators |work=Samsung US site |date=8 September 2010 |accessdate=9 December 2010 }} *[[China Telecom]] offers a [[CDMA2000]] variant '''SCH-I909''' which supports both CDMA and GSM networks *[[China Mobile]] has a [[TD-SCDMA]] variant '''GT-I9008''' which supports the CMMB mobile television service and runs the [[OPhone]] 2.0 platform *[[China Unicom]] has a [[WCDMA]] version '''GT-I9088''' ===In Japan=== *[[NTT Docomo]] carries the '''SC-02B''', an apparent variant of the GT-I9000, but without a front-facing camera. ===In Angola=== Movicel has launched in December 2010 GT-9000 as well as GT-9003. ==Legal== In a lawsuit filed April 15, 2011, Apple accused Samsung of committing patent and trademark infringement with its Galaxy line of mobile products. That includes the Galaxy S smartphone and the Galaxy Tab tablet.{{cite web|title=Apple to Samsung: Stop stealing ideas|url=http://www.cnn.com/2011/TECH/innovation/04/19/apple.samsung.lawsuit.wired/|work=CNN.com|accessdate=19 April 2011}} In later reports in August 2011, Apple was allegedly caught doctoring images that were used in the court patent case against Samsung. {{cite web |url=http://www.bgr.com/2011/08/15/apple-allegedly-doctored-evidence-in-patent-case-against-samsung/ |title=Apple allegedly doctored evidence in patent case against Samsung}} ==See also== *[[Samsung Infuse 4G]] *[[List of Android devices]] *[[Samsung Galaxy Tab]] *[[Nexus S]] *[[Android (operating system)|Android]] *[[Samsung Galaxy S II]] ==References== {{Reflist|colwidth=30em}} ==External links== *[http://galaxys.samsungmobile.com/ Official Samsung Galaxy S homepage] *[http://opensource.samsung.com/ Official Source Code for the Samsung Galaxy S] (Sprint Version is SPH-D700 DI18) *[http://www.samsungapps.com/ Samsung Apps] *[http://www.samsung.com/uk/support/detail/supportPrdDetail.do?menu=FW&prd_mdl_name=GT-I9000#/ Samsung Support page] *[http://www.arm.com/files/pdf/AT_-_NEON_for_Multimedia_Applications.pdf ARM NEON Multimedia Applications] {{Android devices}} {{Samsung phones}} {{Android}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Samsung Galaxy S}} [[Category:Android devices]] [[Category:Samsung mobile phones|Galaxy S]] [[Category:2010 introductions]] [[ar:Ø³Ø§ÙØ³ÙÙØ¬ Ø¬Ø§ÙÙØ³Ù Ø¥Ø³ I9000]] [[bar:Samsung Galaxy S I9000]] [[de:Samsung Galaxy S I9000]] [[es:Samsung i9000 Galaxy S]] [[fa:Ø³Ø§ÙØ³ÙÙÚ¯ Ú¯Ø§ÙÚ©Ø³Û Ø§Ø³]] [[fr:Samsung i9000 Galaxy S]] [[ko:ì¼ì± ê°¤ë­ì S]] [[it:Samsung GT-i9000 Galaxy S]] [[he:Samsung Galaxy S]] [[hu:Samsung Galaxy S]] [[ja:SC-02B]] [[pl:Samsung Galaxy S]] [[ru:Samsung Galaxy S]] [[sk:Samsung Galaxy S]] [[sl:Samsung Galaxy S]] [[fi:Samsung i9000]] [[sv:Samsung Galaxy S]] [[ta:à®à®¾à®®à¯à®à®à¯ à®à¯à®²à®à¯à®¸à®¿ à®à®¸à¯]] [[tr:Samsung i9000 Galaxy S]]
